subject: Track and Field
lead_paragraph: Carmelita Jeter of the United States ran to victory in the women’s 100 meters at the World Athletics Final, clocking 10.67 seconds in the third-fastest time on record Sunday in Thessaloniki, Greece. Only Florence Griffith-Joyner and Marion Jones have run faster. Griffith-Joyner set the world record of 10.49 in 1988, and Jones ran a 10.65 in 1998.
